P101.statement:
If medical advice is needed, have product container
or label at hand.

P102.statement: Keep out of reach of children.

P103.statement: Read carefully and follow all instructions.
P103.conditions:
Consumer products
- omit where P203 is used.

P203.statement:
Obtain, read and follow all safety instructions
before use.

P210.statement:
Keep away from heat, hot surfaces, sparks,
open flames and other ignition sources. No
smoking.

P211.statement:
Do not spray on an open flame or other ignition
source.

P212.statement:
Avoid heating under confinement or reduction
of the desensitizing agent

P220.statement:
Keep away from clothing and other
combustible materials.

P222.statement: Do not allow contact with air.
P222.conditions:
– if emphasis of the hazard statement is deemed
necessary.

P223.statement: Do not allow contact with water.
P223.conditions:
– if emphasis of the hazard statement is deemed
necessary.

P230.conditions:
- for explosive substances and mixtures that are
diluted with solids or liquids, or wetted with,
dissolved or suspended in water or other liquids to
reduce their explosive properties.
…Manufacturer/supplier or competent authority to
specify appropriate material.

P231.statement:
Handle and store contents under inert gas/....
Protect from moisture.
P231.conditions:
– if the substance or mixture reacts readily with
moisture in air.
…Manufacturer/supplier or the competent authority
to specify appropriate liquid or gas if “inert gas” is
not appropriate.

P232.statement:
Handle and store contents under inert gas/....
Protect from moisture.
P232.conditions:
– if the substance or mixture reacts readily with
moisture in air.
…Manufacturer/supplier or the competent authority
to specify appropriate liquid or gas if “inert gas” is
not appropriate.

P233.statement:
Store in a well-ventilated place. Keep container
tightly closed.
P233.conditions:
– if the chemical is volatile and may
generate a hazardous atmosphere.

P235.statement: Store in a well-ventilated place. Keep cool.
P235.conditions:
– for flammable liquids Category 1
and other flammable liquids that are
volatile and may generate an explosive
atmosphere.

P236.statement:
Keep only in original packaging; Division … in
the transport configuration.
P236.conditions:
- To be applied for explosives assigned a division
within Class 1 for transport.
- May be omitted for single packaging where the
transport pictogram displaying the division (within
Class 1) appears.
- May be omitted where the use of different outer
packaging results in different divisions for
transport.
…Manufacturer/supplier or competent authority to
specify the division for transport.

P240.statement:
Ground and bond container and receiving
equipment.
P240.conditions: – if the explosive is electrostatically sensitive.

P241.conditions:
– if the liquid is volatile and may generate an
explosive atmosphere.
– text in square brackets may be used to specify
specific electrical, ventilating, lighting or other
equipment if necessary and as appropriate.
– precautionary statement may be omitted where
local or national legislation introduces more
specific provisions.

P242.conditions:
– if the liquid is volatile and may generate an
explosive atmosphere and if the minimum ignition
energy is very low. (This applies to substances and
mixtures where the minimum ignition energy is
< 0.1 mJ, e.g. carbon disulphide).

P243.statement: Take action to prevent static discharges.
P243.conditions:
– if the liquid is volatile and may generate an
explosive atmosphere.
– may be omitted where local or national
legislation introduces more specific provisions.

P244.statement:
Keep valves and fittings free from oil and
grease.

P250.conditions:
– if the explosive is mechanically sensitive
...Manufacturer/supplier or the competent authority
to specify applicable rough handling.

P251.statement: Do not pierce or burn, even after use.

P260.conditions:
Manufacturer/supplier or the competent authority
to specify applicable physical state(s).

P261.conditions:
– may be omitted if P260 is given on the label.
Manufacturer/supplier or the competent authority
to specify applicable physical state(s).

P262.statement: Do not get in eyes, on skin, or on clothing.

P263.statement:
Avoid contact during pregnancy and while
nursing.

P264.statement:
Wash hands [and…] thoroughly after handling.
Do not touch eyes.
P264.conditions:
- text in square brackets to be used when the
manufacturer/supplier or the competent authority
specify other parts of the hibody to be washed after
handling.

P265.statement:
Wash hands [and…] thoroughly after handling.
Do not touch eyes.
P265.conditions:
- text in square brackets to be used when the
manufacturer/supplier or the competent authority
specify other parts of the hibody to be washed after
handling.

P270.statement:
Do not eat, drink or smoke when using this
product.

P271.statement: Use only outdoors or with adequate ventilation.
P271.conditions:
Manufacturer/supplier to specify what type of
ventilation would be adequate for safe use on the
safety data sheet and in any supplemental safety
instructions provided to consumers.

P272.statement:
Contaminated work clothing should not be
allowed out of the workplace.

P273.conditions: – if this is not the intended use.

P280.statement:
Wear protective gloves/protective clothing/eye
protection/face protection/hearing protection/...
P280.conditions:
- Specify protective gloves and eye/face protection.
Manufacturer/supplier or the competent authority
may further specify type of equipment where
appropriate.

P282.statement:
Wear cold insulating gloves and either face
shield or eye protection.

P283.statement: Wear fire resistant or flame-retardant clothing.

P284.statement:
In case of inadequate ventilation wear
respiratory protection.
P284.conditions:
Manufacturer/supplier to specify on the safety data
sheet what type of ventilation would be adequate
for safe use and provide additional information
with the chemical at the point of use that explains
what type of respiratory equipment may also be
needed.

P301.statement:
IF SWALLOWED: Rinse mouth. Do NOT induce
vomiting.

P302.statement:
IF ON SKIN: Take off immediately all contaminated
clothing. Immediately rinse with water for several
minutes.

P303.statement:
IF ON SKIN (or hair): Take off immediately all
contaminated clothing. Rinse affected areas with
water [or shower].
P303.conditions:
– text in square brackets to be included
where the manufacturer/supplier or the
competent authority considers it
appropriate for the specific chemical.

P304.statement:
IF INHALED: Remove person to fresh air and keep
comfortable for breathing.

P305.statement:
IF IN EYES: Immediately rinse with water for
several minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present
and easy to do. Continue rinsing.

P306.statement:
IF ON CLOTHING: Rinse immediately
contaminated clothing and skin with plenty of water
before removing clothes.

P308.statement:
IF exposed or concerned: Get emergency medical
help immediately.
P308.conditions:
Competent authority or manufacturer /
supplier may add, “Call” followed by the
appropriate emergency telephone
number, or the appropriate emergency
medical help provider, for example, a
poison centre, emergency centre or
doctor.

P316.statement:
If experiencing respiratory symptoms: Get
emergency medical help immediately.
P316.conditions:
Competent authority or
manufacturer/supplier may add, “Call”
followed by the appropriate emergency
telephone number, or the appropriate
emergency medical help provider, for
example, a poison centre, emergency
centre or doctor.

P317.statement: If eye irritation persists: Get medical help.

P318.statement: IF exposed or concerned, get medical advice.

P319.statement: Get medical help if you feel unwell.

P320.statement:
Specific treatment is urgent (see information on this
label and safety data sheet).
P320.conditions:
- if immediate measures that can be
easily applied, such as the
administration of antidote or other
specific treatment are required. These
measures must be specified on the label
and safety data sheet, recognizing
additional detailed instructions,
including any training requirements,
should be provided on the safety data
sheet, if appropriate.

P321.statement:
Specific treatment (see information on this label and
safety data sheet).
P321.conditions:
- if immediate measures that can be
easily applied, such as the
administration of antidote or other
specific treatment are required. These
measures must be specified on the label
and safety data sheet, recognizing
additional detailed instructions,
including any training requirements,
should be provided on the safety data
sheet, if appropriate.
- may be omitted if P320 is given on the
label.

P322.statement:
Specific treatment is urgent (see information on the
safety data sheet).
P322.conditions:
Manufacturer/supplier to reference on
the safety data sheet detailed
instructions, including any training
requirements, to administer an antidote
or other specific treatment.
- may be omitted if P320 is given on the
label.

P323.statement:
Specific treatment (see information on the safety data
sheet).
P323.conditions:
Manufacturer/supplier to reference on
the safety data sheet detailed
instructions, including any training
requirements, to administer an antidote
or other specific treatment.
- may be omitted if P321 or P322 is
given on the label.

P330.statement:
IF SWALLOWED: Rinse mouth. Do NOT induce
vomiting.

P331.statement:
IF SWALLOWED: Rinse mouth. Do NOT induce
vomiting.

P332.statement: If skin irritation occurs: Get medical help.
P332.conditions:
– may be omitted when P333+P317 is
given on the label.

P333.statement: If skin irritation or rash occurs: Get medical help.

P334.statement:
IF ON SKIN: Brush off loose particles from skin and
immerse in cool water [or wrap in wet bandages].
P334.conditions:
– text in square brackets to be used for
pyrophoric solids

P335.statement:
IF ON SKIN: Brush off loose particles from skin and
immerse in cool water [or wrap in wet bandages].
P335.conditions:
– text in square brackets to be used for
pyrophoric solids

P336.statement:
Immediately thaw frosted parts with lukewarm
water. Do not rub affected area. Get medical help.

P337.statement: If eye irritation persists: Get medical help.

P338.statement:
IF IN EYES: Immediately rinse with water for
several minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present
and easy to do. Continue rinsing.

P340.statement:
IF INHALED: Remove person to fresh air and keep
comfortable for breathing.

P342.statement:
If experiencing respiratory symptoms: Get
emergency medical help immediately.

Competent authority or
manufacturer/supplier may add, “Call”

minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present and easy
to do. Continue rinsing.

IF ON SKIN (or hair): Take off immediately all

P364.statement:

P373.statement:

P381.statement: In case of leakage, eliminate all ignition sources.

P402.statement: Store in a dry place. Store in a closed container.

P403.statement:
